Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Nakitngaa’in mapasnava, mukumbu masnanava munhaan pasnanava’an. Tupa lalavian tu,” Mindangkaza! Masumsuma!",It’s time for class
the teacher walked into the classroom
我今天七點到學校。: and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”"
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34909/5: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tusqit saam tupa tu,” Uninang! Masnanava!",We said loudly
“Hi
我今天七點到學校。: teacher.”"

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu maspasnava a, isnava’an saam masnanava malasBunun masisipul.
In class, the teacher taught us the Bunun language of numbers.
我今天七點到學校。: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Makilansan saam masnanava masipul, tusuas i masisipul tu sintusaus.
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Mapinqansiapin saak madia malasBunun tu qalinga.
I have learned many Bunun languages.
我今天七點到學校。: 我學會好多族語。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Daqdaqanin saak munhaan pasnanava’an, lusbut mapasnava malasBunun, nabazbaz saak mapatan’a tina.
I go to school every day, I learn the Bunun language every day, and I want to tell my mother.
我今天七點到學校。: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tupa’un inaak ngaan tu Pa’ian.
My name is Pa’ian.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的名字是Pa'ian。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tupa’un inaak tama ngaan tu Umas.
My dad’s name is Umas.
我今天七點到學校。: 我爸爸的名字是Umas。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tupa’un inaak tina ngaan tu Sani.
My mother’s name is Sani.
我今天七點到學校。: 我媽媽的名字是Sani。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Mas’an inaak qamisan laupaku.
I am 10 years old.
我今天七點到學校。: 我今年10歲。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Haiza inaak tuqasnanaz, tupa’un naipa tu Laung, mas’an qan tas’a qamisan naipa laupaku.
I have a brother, his name is Laung, he is 11 years old.
我今天七點到學校。: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Laung，他今年11歲。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Muskun inaam tu pasnanava’an.
We study in the same school.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們在同一間學校讀書。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Mazima saak siin inaak tu tuqasnanaz tusasaus.
Both my brother and I like to sing.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Mazima saak sungqaqaul, maaq tu pal’uun a, muskun saam tastulumaq sungqaqaul.
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Mazima saak mapasaqaal baqlu tu kaviaz, maqtu saam tuskun tusasaus siin muskun sungqaqaul.
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Isia saak Bunun siduq tu uvaz’az.
I am an Bunun child.
我今天七點到學校。: 我是布農族的小孩。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Takihaan inaam lumaq Salitung.
Our family lives in Salitung.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們家住在豐丘村。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Hahima saam tastulumaq bunun.
There are five people in our family.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們家共有五個人。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tatau saam tastulumaq taisis’aan.
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Muskun saak tama tina tuqasnanaz siin tuqasnau’az.
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.
我今天七點到學校。: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Malaungkav inaak tama, kisacu naipa.
My father is tall and he is a policeman.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Makuis inaak tina, Ising naipa.
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: MalasBunun tama ihaan lumaq pabazbaz zami.
My father speaks the Bunun language with us at home.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Musuqais saam munhaan asang i pal’uunin.
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們暑假都會回部落。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Muskun saak inaak tu tais’aan madamu aukauk.
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Madaidaz saak inaak tastulumaq tu tais’aan.
I like our family very much.
我今天七點到學校。: 我很喜歡我們家的人。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: taskun saak haip tina munata tantungu.
I went out with my mother today.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Mataisqang a diqanin tu qani’anan, nitu makazav, nii amin maklang, kamamakazvav a hivhiv.
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.
我今天七點到學校。: 白天的天空很晴朗，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Ihaan saam masu’ismutan mama’un paang, sanvali’un lutbu taisqang, mastaan tu manangqat.
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tungquvali, mindangqasin a diqanin.
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.
我今天七點到學校。: 下午，天空變紅了。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Masingav saak tina tu, mavia diqanin tu mindangqasin i?
I asked my mother why the sky is red.
我今天七點到學校。: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的？

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tupa tina tu, lau naminsuma’in balivusan.
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.
我今天七點到學校。: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Uka luhum ihaan diqanin tu sanavan, minsuma’in a bintuqan.
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.
我今天七點到學校。: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Namulumaqin amin saam.
We were going home too.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們也要回家了。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Ihaan mulumaq tu inundadanan, masisaupa saak bintuqan tukas’aang.
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,
我今天七點到學校。: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maqtu’ang balivusan nitu mun’iti, asa’ang saak munata tantungu.
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.
我今天七點到學校。: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Inaak pasnanava’an qai, ihaan inaam lumaq tu dingalan, daqdaqanin saak kanbantas munhaan pasnanava’an, kanbantas amin mulumaq.
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Nii inaam pasnanava’an madaing, nitu papia isnanava’an, mapasaqaal amin saam.
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Mudinuun amin isnanava’an ihaan tindangkulan, muskun pismamali, tuskun pababazbaz.
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.
我今天七點到學校。: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Muskun amin saam inaam tu masnanava pistanaqtaq. Maszang a pasnanava’an tastulumaqan.
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.
我今天七點到學校。: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Daqdaqanin saam ma’a’asik, muskun mapiningzav i pasnava’an.
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Haiza bunun maqaisqais i vanaas tu tidanuman, haiza bunun ma’asik.
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.
我今天七點到學校。: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Asikun zami pasnanava’an tu isaq’isaq, mapa’uskun kuzakuza, daqdaqanin maningzav amin a pasnanava’an.
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Takna, munhaan saak qudas tantungu.
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Talmadia’in saam nitu mapasaduu, matusalpu saak istaa.
We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu sadu’an saak qudas, pakaunan saak suika, paqudan saak savil.
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.
我今天七點到學校。: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Madavus isia qudas sinsuaz tu suika, tutuza tu manambuq kaunun.
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.
我今天七點到學校。: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maduu amin saak quu dudas tu savil. masihal amin qudan.
I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.
我今天七點到學校。: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu tungquvali, muskun saak qudasnau’az mapit’ia paitutungquvali.
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.
我今天七點到學校。: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Madia isia qudasnau’az sinpit’ia paitutunguvali, haiza iskaan, haiza maitulkuk, haiza bahat, haizang ciqutciqut.
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu mina’unin paitutungquvali ka, munhaan saam pitsanglavan matingus sanglav.
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.
我今天七點到學校。: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Madia isia qudas siniza tu hutan tai siin tulkum pinaak, nadasun zaku mulumaq.
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Mapalavaaz saak intaa, tupa tu namuqna ata mapasaduu.
I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.
我今天七點到學校。: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Haip tu qani’anan, dasun saam masnanava munhaan sasaipukan takismumuut, ihaan saam hilav maldailaz baliv kipu.
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu mukumbu’in saam a, tupa masnanava tu,” Antanngaus qai saipukan qazam, antanhiku qai saipukan ivut, anaka amin amu saduduu.",After entering the zoo
the teacher said
我今天七點到學校。: "There are birds in the front and snakes in the back
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34909/5: so you can visit them yourself.""
column5: 進入動物園後，老師說:「前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。」

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Mapising saak ivut, paaqpun nii saak saduu ivut.
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.
我今天七點到學校。: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Sinaduu’in saak madia tu qazam, ihaan aingka lukis daza kusbabai, haiza tuquu ihaan lukis tu luak malsasabaq.
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.
我今天七點到學校。: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Haiza ihaan sasaipukan takismumuut kumbu zuu, tas’asikis siin lai’iung, nii saak sinaduu maupata tu takismumuut. Manahip is’aang tu sinaduu’in haip tu qani’anan.
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.
我今天七點到學校。: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Siniza’in saak madia tu qaningu, ispasaduu inaak tu tama tina.
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.
我今天七點到學校。: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaki muqnin a, nataskun saak tama tina mun’ita.
Next time I will come with my parents.
我今天七點到學校。: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Haip tu ail’uan, taskun saak tuqasnau’az munhaan Taitu mintivi pantama’un.
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Misnahaan saam Taihuku tunkisia munhaan Taitu.
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tunahaanin Taitu, ma’unting pantama’un laihli munhaan pandudu’an laihli antala zami.
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.
我今天七點到學校。: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Nitu daqvisan isia pantama’unta tu lumaq, muhiav ma’untaing laihli ka tunadiipin.
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.
我今天七點到學校。: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Haiza ihaan pantama’un tu lumaq dingalan madaing patankaunan tu bukzavan, taskun saam tunsuzainsia munhaan bukzavanta.
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.
我今天七點到學校。: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Ihaan patankaunan tu bukzavan, dasun saam pantama’un paka’un sidih siin tuntas’asikis.
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.
我今天七點到學校。: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Sanavan, muskun saam munhaan Puut tu asang ma’un qaising.
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.
我今天七點到學校。: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Madia ihaan Puut tu asang laihli, paaqpun tundaza saam utuvai mun’ita.
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.
我今天七點到學校。: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu namudaanin saam a, tangqa’iunin inaam tu utuvai, muhazin saam tunlaihli musuqais.
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.
我今天七點到學校。: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Musuqaisin saam laupaku munhaan Taihuku, nitu niapun tu, lau ukilimanin isia pantama’unta tu utuvai.
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.
我今天七點到學校。: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu uvaz’azang saak a, takihaan saak Naihumpu. Maaq tu isnava’anin saak a, mulusqu munhaan Huli, takihaanin amin bukzavan miqumis.
When we were young, our family lived in Naihumpu. After I started school, we moved to Puli and have been living in the city ever since.
我今天七點到學校。: 小時候我們家住在內茅埔，上學以後，就搬到了埔里，一直在都市裡生活。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu ihaanin saak zaingaku isnava’an a, isnava’an saak pali’uni Takisilazan miniqumis tu kainqansiapan, maqansiap tu, haiza takihaan Taivangti Takisilazan miniqumis madia makitvaivi tu iniqumisan.
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.
我今天七點到學校。: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Paaqpu, maaq tu pal’uunin a, muskun saak inaak tuqasnanaz munhaan asang kilim madadaingaz tantungu, asa pinqansiap anak’anak siduq iniqumisan tu kaitaiklasan.
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.
我今天七點到學校。: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Mavau’unin qamisan a madaingaza, qaitu, maszangang talmaiduu’ang sadu’an.
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.
我今天七點到學校。: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Singavun zaku tu piaq isiata qalinga qansiapun? Madauzung naipa malasBunun, maqtu amin malasPuut siin malasLipuun pababazbaz.
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Bunun, as well as Hokkien and Japanese.
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他會哪些語言，他的布農語說得很流利，也會說閩南語和日本話。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu singavunin a, tudiipin saak maqansiap tu, misnahaan naipa uvaz’azang isnava’an malasLipuun, binanau’az qai Bunun. Maaq tu kuzakuza naipa qai, mapasaqaal madia tu Puut. Paaqpun, madia isiata qansiapun qalinga isbabazbaz.
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Bunun, and he knows many Hokkien at work, so he can speak so many languages.
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是布農族人，而他工作上認識許多閩南家人，所以他會說這麼多語言。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu tantungu saam a, madia isia madaingazta isbazbaz pali’uni qanup tu kaitiklasan.
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Anatupa tu nii a qalinga aminun zaku itqaal tan’a ka, langati makusia saam ima-zingva siza qaningu, namaqtu’ang uqna’un ikmantukun tan’a.
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.
我今天七點到學校。: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Nii saak matlaz maqansiap anak’anak iniqumisan tu uvavaz’azang, matukaz’av tu anak’anak qai Takisilazan tu miniqumis.
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.
我今天七點到學校。: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu madia’in inaak qansiapun a, haiza’in iniliskinan tu Bunun saak, makitvaivi tu bunun, haiza’an amin maqtu iskukuniv tu kaitaikladsan.
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Bunun is unique and something to be proud of.
我今天七點到學校。: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為[布農族]人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq haip tu dalavdav a, namusuqaisin naubahbnanaz mulumaq.
My younger brother is going home this evening.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Muskun saak qudasnau’az munhaan babalivan mabaliv tulkuk, mapalsanus mapit’ia manambuq tu kakaunun ispaka’un naubahnanaz.
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu angqai saam babalivan sanglav a, madia ihaan babalivan laupang siniza tu sanglav.
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: mabaliv saam sanglav, bahat siin tau’las-dangqas.
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們買了空心菜、南瓜和胡蘿蔔。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Andingalan babalivan kakaunun tu bunun tupa tu,“ Madavus inaak tu bunglai siin qalup, mabaliva tu tikis.”
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”
我今天七點到學校。: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜，買一些吧!」

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Mabalivin saam bunglai siin qalup.
We bought pineapples and peaches.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Angqai saam babalivan titi, tupa Taukii tu,“ Ma’aq isuu nabalivun? Masmuq tu madaing a haip tu maitulkuk, tas’a qai tau sabah sui.”
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”
我今天七點到學校。: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tupa qudas tu mastaan maqlis, tusingav Taukii tu, lau maqtu vanaqan tu tikis sui.
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Qaitu, tupa Taukii tu nitu maqlis, ni’in maqtu vanaqan sui.
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.
我今天七點到學校。: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tupa ka andingalan tu Taukii tu, mabaliva inaak tu iskaan, madaing a iskaan a, nitu maqlis.
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.
我今天七點到學校。: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Kinuzin a, mabalivin saam maitulkuk siin iskaan, musuqais mulumaq mapit’ia tastu pangka tu pan’ai’an.
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.
我今天七點到學校。: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Talbuntu’in mantatala, isdumdumin a diqanin.
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.
我今天七點到學校。: 等了好久，天已經黑了。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Patunpaklis naubahnanaz tupa tu, musqa sivitai nitu maqtu pal’uun, nahaanin muqnin tu islungu’an tudiip maqtu musuqais.
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.
我今天七點到學校。: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tupa qudasnau’az tu, madia a sinpit’ia, luklasi amin tastulumaq tu tais’aan kuskun ma’un!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tan’ali saam madia tu taisis’aan, kuskun ma’un manambuq paitusanavan tu kakaunun.
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Haiza inaak tatini u’uskunan tupa’un tu Tiang, lusbut naipa panpupungul madas ikma’ai’un.
I have a classmate named Tiang, he often forgets to bring things.
我今天七點到學校。: 我有一個同學叫Tiang，他常常忘記帶東西。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaki isnava’an a, simul naipa u’uskunan ispapatas, isqaqaisqais nait patasan.
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.
我今天七點到學校。: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Mus’an mupusan muti’un, tudiip saam mapasimul istaa.
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.
我今天七點到學校。: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Qaitu, madikla naipa i, lusbut simul ikma’ai’un a nitu masuqais sinimulan.
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.
我今天七點到學校。: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Kinuzin, ni’in amin saam asa mapasimul istaa ikma’ai’un.
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.
我今天七點到學校。: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Haiza tu tastudiqanin, muskun saam munhaan bukzavan tantungu.
One day, we all went on an outing together.
我今天七點到學校。: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Ihaan inundadanan, asa Tiang munhaan pattaki’an, qaitu, panpungul naipa madas isqaqaisqais tu haqil.
On the way, Tiang wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.
我今天七點到學校。: 路途中，Tiang想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Masaupa naipa u’uskunan simul isqaqaisqais tu haqil, qaitu, antalam amin saam tu, nii amin minadas.
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.
我今天七點到學校。: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tin’iangiang a Tiang tatangis, masuqnuq naipa tupa tu, “Mavia amu tu nitu mapasimul zaku isqaqaisqais tu haqil i!”
Tiang aw burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!
我今天七點到學校。: Tiang急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tupa ka u’uskunan istaa tu, “Maupa i nii asu ana’anak madas a, musasuu tu, mapasimul saam su’u ikma’ai’un a, nii amin asu masuqais.”
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!
我今天七點到學校。: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu laqbingin a, matingmut a Tiang munhaan pasnanava’an, suqaisun amin sinimul Tiang tu ikma’ai’un pisia u’uskunan.
The next day at school, Tiang arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.
我今天七點到學校。: 隔天上學，Tiang很早就到學校了，Tiang把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Matukaz’av Tiang masisaupa u’uskunan bazbaz tu, na’anak’in naipa qabasin madas ikma’ai’un. Matumasqing amin naipa u’uskunan tu, mituza qabas mapasimul istaa ikmama’ai’un.
Tiang apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.
我今天七點到學校。: Tiang向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Inaak tu tama qai, takihaan asang qaqanup tu mamangan.
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu uvaz’azang saak ka, muskun tama siin pantama’un sanavan munata, madas i via siin busul.
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.
我今天七點到學校。: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu tusqangin diqanin a, madas naingka qinanup tu titi musuqais.
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Mintun sia vanis, mintun sia haval, minitun amin haiza linas.
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.
我今天七點到學校。: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Pisihalun intaa ihaan lumaq mapaqusil titi, ispaququsil i taisis’aan.
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 他們會在家裡將獵物分好，分享給族人。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Lusbuq saak tupa tama tu, asa makilansan tama qanup.
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.
我今天七點到學校。: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tupa tama zaku tu, maaki taldaingin saak a, tudiipin madas zaku munludun.
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Takihaan asang tu maiduduaz, maqansiap amin makusia haqu madamu takismumuut. Matas’i naingka lismusqut siin labantiq tu haqu.
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.
我今天七點到學校。: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maqansiap inaak tama matas’i lismusqut tu sinpalasung.Tupa tama tu, iskusia naipi madamu linas, asa ata tu matqas masailang takismumuut tu dinapan. Maaq a sinpalasung tu haqu qai, asa tu pihanun takimumuut nalaqaiban tu daan.
My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tis’uni saak asa mahiav taskun madadaingaz munludun qaqanup, daqdaqanin saak pinanaam matas’i haqu. Muhiav a, namaqtu’in inaak sintas’i tu haqu, tutuza tu udamu’an i takismumuut.
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Sinaduu’in tama inaak tu sintas’i ka, tupa naipa zaku tu, namin’uni saak qabasin mamangan tu qaqanup.
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Laupaku, taldaingin saak, mama saak inaak tu busul-kavi siin kuus, makilansan tama munhaan ludun qanup.
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.
我今天七點到學校。: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu musiqais munhaan asang qai, mapaqusil qinanup tu titi pisia taisis’aan.
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tupa tama tu, “Asa ata tu matumasqing maimadadaingaz tu sintuqumis, mintuza ata uqanupan i madia tu sinpapanaq.”
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Halasan azak haip tu tingmut munhaan pasnanava’an.
I was late for school this morning.
我今天七點到學校。: 我早上上學遲到了。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu tunahaan azak pasnanava’an qai, panpungul azaK madas kavaang.
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.
我今天七點到學校。: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Nii azak minadas ma’aqma’aq tu qaimangsut.
I didn't bring anything with me.
我今天七點到學校。: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu isnava’an azak qai, muskun azak u’uskunan saduu patasan.
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.
我今天七點到學校。: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu palatanam mapatas qai, pasimulan azak u’uskunan ispapatas siin isqaqaisqais.
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.
我今天七點到學校。: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tupa’un azak masnanava tu, “Tingmuta muqnin min’anuqu, kaa’in halasan!",The teacher told me
"Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""
我今天七點到學校。: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Inaak kaviaz qai tupa’un tu Talum, isia amin naipa Bunun siduq tu uvaz’az.
My good friend’s name is Talum, and he is also an Bunun child.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的好朋友叫Talum，他也是布農族的小孩。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Muskun azam ihaan Izukan tu asang masisipul patasan.
We study together in the Izukan tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們一起在卓溪崙天部落讀書。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Masiqailis azam muskun tan’a madadaingaz taqu paliqabasan, maqansiap amin azam malasBunun.
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Bunun proficiently.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說布農語。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Malaungkav azak tu masmuq amin, manisnis makuis a Talum.
I am tall and overweight, while Talum is short and thin.
我今天七點到學校。: 我很高也很胖，Talum很矮也很瘦。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Matanaqtaq a Talum, mazima amin azam istaa.
Talum is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.
我今天七點到學校。: Talum很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Haip qai isia pasnanava’an paintataiv tu qani’anan, papia ka inhamu’un tu paintataiv.
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Haiza pasibutbut, kantundaq mali, tindangkul, uluzi siin manaq busul-kavi.
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
我今天七點到學校。: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Minhamu azak tindangkul tu paintataiv.
I participated in the running competition.
我今天七點到學校。: 我比賽跑步。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu tindangkul azak a, tiskapat azak, madia ihaan buqtung tu qaidang mutaul.
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.
我今天七點到學校。: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Qaitu mindangkaz azak, maldauk masaupa tanangaus tindangkul.
But I stood up and continued running forward.
我今天七點到學校。: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu tunahaan azak panatpu’an qai, manahip amin a sikaupa tu bunun.
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.
我今天七點到學校。: 我到終點時，所有人都很開心。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Ananatupa tu nii azak makitngangaus tindangkul, qaitu manahip azak, maupa’i pankanaqtungin azak paintataiv.
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.
我今天七點到學校。: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Taskun azak takna tama munhaan inaak tu pantama’un tantungu.
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Milu’lu’in isia pantama’un tu bantas.
My uncle injured his foot.
我今天七點到學校。: 叔叔的腳受傷了。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tupa’un azam istaa tu, haiza ihaan tavi mubuat tu luak.
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.
我今天七點到學校。: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu minkangna naipa tavi qai, misnahaan tavi mutingkul pananastu.
He fell off the roof while repairing it.
我今天七點到學校。: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Madas tama ki maiqanvang tu titi siin saviki isaiv inaak tu pantama’un.
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Muskun azak pantama’un ihaan sapalan pababazbaz, taqu naipa madia paliqabasan tu sintataqu.
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu namudaanin azak qai, tumasqingun azak pantama’un tu malaungkavin, talmainduu’in amin sadu’an.
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.
我今天七點到學校。: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tupa azak tu, “Maaki mindaduu’in pantama’un tu bantas a, munhaana amin inaam tu lumaq tantungu ki muqnin.”
I said, “When your foot gets better, come to our house next time and visit us.”
我今天七點到學校。: 我說：「等叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Ihaan 2022 tu painsanan, tis’uni Sehu maqtu ihaan Mivunsiu sinpatas tu ngaan “pantas’aun malasBunun tu ngaan mapatas” tu sinkuzakuza mu’ampuk mapaliqansiap.
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.
我今天七點到學校。: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Mintivi azak malibuntu’in masisaupa Sehu makas’aang tu, maqtu a ihaan Mivunsiu sinpatas tu ngaan “pantas’aun malasBunun tu ngaan mapatas” sinkuzakuza tu maindudu’az Taupa Suqluman.
I interviewed Taupas Suqluman, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.
我今天七點到學校。: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Taupas Suqluman。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Mapatupa’in azam tu na’ihaan haip tu islungqu’an tu diqanin munhaan isiata tu lumaq mintivi istaa.
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu mintivi azak istaa qai, masisaupa naipa zaku mapinqansiap isiata sinpatingaan tu kanada’an, madas amin zaku mapasaqaal isiata tu tastulumaqan, isiata al’asangan tu asang.
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tusingavun zaku naipa tu, mavia tu malmananu sisasaa tupa tu, asa sinpatas ngaan tu inkangna’an mapatas, nii qu qabas sinpatas tu ngaan masihal?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tupa naipa zaku tu, maaki makusia malasTauluu tu ngaan mapatas qai, nii tu maqtu pitqas tumantuk isiata nanu tu ngaan, haiza’ang bunun tungaan luklas zaku tu “大先生”, tutuza tu min’uni paqainanan tu sinkuzakuza.
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Da Xian Sheng
我今天七點到學校。: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34909/5: 他對我說，因為用中文字並不能準確的傳達他的名字，其他人還會叫他「大先生」，也因此鬧出不少笑話。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Tupa Taupas Suqluman tu, “Maaq a sinpatas malasBunun tu ngaan qai, siata nanu inaam mamantuk tu ngaan. Maaq inaak tu ngaan qai mapitqas inaam tu tastusiduqan, inaam tu tastulumaqan, taki’isaq azam tu miniqumis, maqtu’ang malalabas tu taisis’aan maqtu sisuqais anak’anak tu ngaan.”
Taupas Suqluman said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group
我今天七點到學校。: our family
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34909/5: our identity. I hope more fellow tribespeople can reclaim their own names.\""
column5: Taupas Suqluman說：「原住民語書寫的名字才是我們真正的名字。我的名字代表了我們的族群、我們的家族、我們的身分，希望能有更多族人找回自己的名字。」

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Muskun azak qudasnau’az takna munhaan babalivan mapabaliv sanglav, madas a qudasnau’az madia kain’anakan masuaz tu sanglav, matas’i amin madia manambuq tu kakaunun ispaka’un taisis’aan.
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.
我今天七點到學校。: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Mazima amin taisis’aan isia qudasnau’az tu babalivan, madia bunun mabaliv dauqpuut siin pa’isaz tikis, madia bunun tanam ma’un isiata sinpit’ia mahansum tu pan’ai’an.
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.
我今天七點到學校。: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Isiata sinhanat tu li’li’ siin sinpit’ia tu maduq qaising qai mastaan tu manambuq kaunun, haizang makusia qaimus sinhanat maivanis tu titi, madia taisis’aan tis’uni kaihansuman minsuma, ihaan amin inaam babalivan tu tanangaus maldailaz.
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.
我今天七點到學校。: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq tu mahanat a qudasnau’az qai, ihaan azak dingalan malhanu ki minisuma tu taisis’aan, ihaan azak dingalan tusqit luluklas tupa tu, “Kain’anakan zami ka sanglavun sinsuaz, masihal a sintal’ia, kavavaa’a mun’iti mabaliv!”
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown
我今天七點到學校。: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34909/5: 奶奶煮東西的時候，我在旁邊招攬客人。我在一旁大喊著：「蔬菜都是自己種的，天然有機，趕快來買喔!」

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Mahaipi inaam isbaliv tu sanglav pit’aminun mabaliv, tupa qudasnau’az tu, “Tis’uni amin haiza isuu tu sin’indangaz.”
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""
我今天七點到學校。: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Maaq a sinkuzakuzakun qai, mapinqansiapin zaku pali’uni Takisilazan miniqumis tu sinsusuaz siin kakaunun tu kaiqansiapan, musasuu tu matlazin maqansiap malkasia babalivan sinkuzakuza tu iniqdi’an.
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.
我今天七點到學校。: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。

Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnana: Sadu’an zaku qudasnau’az haiza’an malkasia itu qabas Takisilazan miniqumis kakaunun tu kaibaqisan is’aang, mastaan azak matunahip matumasqing.
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
我今天七點到學校。: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常高興和榮幸。
